intro: Maytenus domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican mayten, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Caribbean, particularly Dominica and other islands in the Lesser Antilles. It belongs to the family Cornaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits containing one or two seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
